channel.title: iPhone not working
channel.description:
Well, I've had this problem for about 2 weeks; honestly might aswell try asking any of you guys to see if you know the solution [b][i](if you can't be asked reading the story, just scroll to the end)[/i][/b]
[center][b]STORYTIME[/b][/center] So this shit iPhone that I decided to buy (the iPhone 4S), the flash of the iPhone would not turn off no matter what I did; I tried to drain the battery; I tried turning it on and off. I saw the new update 8.1.3 and thought it would perhaps fix the problem. I tried to update via iTunes on PC... But since Apple can't even deliver an update properly without fucking up, the installation failed halfway through and I was stuck on a loading screen on my iPhone. Waited for a while.. it wouldn't go so I put my phone into DFU mode. Then I booted it out of DFU mode and tried loading the phone up; the Apple logo pops up and then the phone turns off. I've tried restoring and downgrading to 8.1.2 but whenver I try to downgrade or even restore, it pops up with this (from Google):
[img]http://www.cydiaos.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Error-3194-alert-box.jpg[/img]
tl;dr iTunes shows the error "3194" when trying to update/downgrade/restore no matter what I try
Thanks for helping :D

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:23, topic:550263”]Lol you should read apple’s solution to error 1:

[quote]Check for hardware issues
Related errors: 1, 3, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 20, 21, 23, 26, 27, 28, 29, 34, 35, 36, 37, 40, 1002, 1004, 1011, 1012, 1014, 1667, or 1669.
These errors mean that your device or computer might have a hardware issue that stops the update or restore from completing.
Check that your security software and settings aren’t blocking your device from communicating with the Apple update server.
Then try to restore your iOS device two more times while connected with a cable, computer, and network you know are good.
Make sure that your security software and settings are allowing communication between your device and update servers.
If you still see the error message when you update or restore, contact Apple support.[/quote]
https://support.apple.com/en-us/TS3694[/quote]
Yeah right now I was thinking about that. If this doesn’t work, it probably was a hardware fault; the flashlight is continuously on too. I’ll head over to the place I bought this iPhone from and see if they can do anything (or perhaps they’ll refer me to Apple).
Right now, I’ve almost finished downloading the 8.1.3 IPSW and I’m firstly going to try updating via iTunes. If that doesn’t seem to work, then I’ll try a different iPhone recovery software that I’ve found on the internet. “Lewao”

EDIT: http://gyazo.com/f38de884bc4d7efd462ee93fb977288a
Gets to that and then throws me the error 1. Definitely a hardware problem I think. Before I head over to the shops, would it be worth it to open up the phone and take a look inside and check the flashlight out; I feel as though that could be the culprit.

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Lol you should read apple’s solution to error 1:

Check for hardware issues Related errors: 1, 3, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 20, 21, 23, 26, 27, 28, 29, 34, 35, 36, 37, 40, 1002, 1004, 1011, 1012, 1014, 1667, or 1669. These errors mean that your device or computer might have a hardware issue that stops the update or restore from completing. Check that your security software and settings aren't blocking your device from communicating with the Apple update server. Then try to restore your iOS device two more times while connected with a cable, computer, and network you know are good. Make sure that your security software and settings are allowing communication between your device and update servers. If you still see the error message when you update or restore, contact Apple support.
https://support.apple.com/en-us/TS3694

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:550263”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=669176.msg4475039#msg4475039 date=1425247515]

Restore the iPhone and then jailbreak it.

I can’t restore, that’s the whole problem!

Restore the iPhone and then jailbreak it.

Thanks but I’ve passed the 3194 error and reached error 1.
[/quote]
Try booting to DFU mode:
http://www.iphonehacks.com/put-iphone-in-dfu-mode[/quote]
It gets stuck on this:
http://gyazo.com/f2f5283dfdc3dac8ebbf6157646e1b18
Which ends up showing me this:
http://gyazo.com/597ac335b916367677d9e1c8806ee8ea

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:21, topic:550263”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=669176.msg4475042#msg4475042 date=1425250255]

Restore the iPhone and then jailbreak it.

I can’t restore, that’s the whole problem!

Restore the iPhone and then jailbreak it.

Thanks but I’ve passed the 3194 error and reached error 1.

Try booting to DFU mode:
http://www.iphonehacks.com/put-iphone-in-dfu-mode

He stated he already did that in the OP
[/quote]
Not when he had error 1 though.
[hr]
Have you tried downloaded the latest iOS and manually updating (if still possible).
I believe you would either shift click or ctrl click the restore button in itunes.[/quote]
Alright I’ll try that, thanks.
I’ll edit or something when I’ve had an attempt

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

vortex:

yyyeahh you proly won’t be able to downgrade anymore unless you jailbreak it, so get the 8.1.2 ipsw or whatever works and jailbreak it with whatever

So I should try jailbreaking it?
I guess worth a try

EDIT: No jailbreaking software can find the iPhone, because right now it counts as an inactive (turned off) iPhone; only iTunes can recognise it and automatically tries to update/restore. Ugh!

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:550263”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=669176.msg4474736#msg4474736 date=1425065062]

Apple doesn’t allow downgrading iOS. It used to be possible, but with later firmware updates (like iOS 6…) it stopped being possible.

Basically end of story.

The only way you could is maybe if you saved the SHSH Blobs and had a jailbroke iOS.

It’s actually possible, but I’m just going to go with what you say for now. I’m trying to just bring my iPhone back alive. I don’t care if I have to reset the whole phone; I just want to get this working again. I tried running TinyUmbrella and starting the TSS server. But I ended up with error 11.

Any other solutions?
[/quote]
I’ve tried with many programs and tutorials and etc. I’ve been in your position. It isn’t possible anymore. You missed the window:

[quote]UPDATE: Unfortunately, Apple has finally stopped signing iOS 8.1.2, which means you can’t downgrade to iOS 8.1.2 if you updated to iOS 8.1.3.
[/quote]
http://www.gottabemobile.com/2015/01/27/how-to-downgrade-to-ios-8-1-2-from-ios-8-1-3/[/quote]
Oh, I downgraded my friend’s iPad so it was jailbreakable but that was like a week before Apple stopped signing 8.1.2
Thanks for telling me though, I won’t try to downgrade anymore.

EDIT: The downgraded versions of iTunes still won’t work. Thanks for trying to help though Lin.

Any more ideas? :o

EDIT2: Ok so I’m getting the error 1 now. I’ve been searching up solutions online; none of them seem to work

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:9, topic:550263”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669176.msg4474734#msg4474734 date=1425064634]
Apple doesn’t allow downgrading iOS. It used to be possible, but with later firmware updates (like iOS 6…) it stopped being possible.

Basically end of story.

The only way you could is maybe if you saved the SHSH Blobs and had a jailbroke iOS.
[/quote]
It’s actually possible, but I’m just going to go with what you say for now. I’m trying to just bring my iPhone back alive. I don’t care if I have to reset the whole phone; I just want to get this working again. I tried running TinyUmbrella and starting the TSS server. But I ended up with error 11.

Any other solutions? :/[/quote]
I’ve tried with many programs and tutorials and etc. I’ve been in your position. It isn’t possible anymore. You missed the window:

UPDATE: Unfortunately, Apple has finally stopped signing iOS 8.1.2, which means you can’t downgrade to iOS 8.1.2 if you updated to iOS 8.1.3.
http://www.gottabemobile.com/2015/01/27/how-to-downgrade-to-ios-8-1-2-from-ios-8-1-3/

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:6, topic:550263”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=669176.msg4474727#msg4474727 date=1425063739]

Make sure your host files in C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\ ain’t blocking apple servers.

Nope, I’ve even reset the host file too.

Try connect the phone, starting TinyUmbrella’s TSS server then once its started try to restore/update which ever you are trying.

Sure, but one question; isn’t TinyUmbrella only useful if the iPhone is jailbroken?
Either way I’ll go ahead and try it.
[/quote]
I’m honestly not too sure but I have these kind of problems/errors every time I either go to update or restore an iphone or jailbreak one.

Sometimes I have to use my laptop from back in 2005 and for some reason it works first time.[/quote]
That gives me an idea; after I try this attempt via TinyUmbrella, perhaps using another computer to update it may work?

EDIT: Reset the host file one more time and tried updating via iTunes one last time. Error 3194 is gone and now I’ve got a new one:
http://gyazo.com/766e720de9683db25e90a68cfd68178f

Read full topic

item.title: iPhone not working
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Well, I’ve had this problem for about 2 weeks; honestly might aswell try asking any of you guys to see if you know the solution (if you can’t be asked reading the story, just scroll to the end)

[center]STORYTIME[/center]
So this shit iPhone that I decided to buy (the iPhone 4S), the flash of the iPhone would not turn off no matter what I did; I tried to drain the battery; I tried turning it on and off. I saw the new update 8.1.3 and thought it would perhaps fix the problem. I tried to update via iTunes on PC…
But since Apple can’t even deliver an update properly without fucking up, the installation failed halfway through and I was stuck on a loading screen on my iPhone. Waited for a while… it wouldn’t go so I put my phone into DFU mode. Then I booted it out of DFU mode and tried loading the phone up; the Apple logo pops up and then the phone turns off. I’ve tried restoring and downgrading to 8.1.2 but whenver I try to downgrade or even restore, it pops up with this (from Google):

tl;dr iTunes shows the error “3194” when trying to update/downgrade/restore no matter what I try

Thanks for helping

Read full topic
